Reviews.Title: “Spacious and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: 10minutesturkish
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel near the Biltmore. The Homewood Suites was a great place to stay. Very spacious suite and would certainly stay again. The front desk person was helpful and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable spacious place”
Reviews.Author: 66Champs
Reviews.Content: More room than I needed traveling alone one. These are true suites with separated rooms and a real kitchenette with range, large fridge, dishwasher and dishware. Nicely appointed. I think the rate was $199, during spring training, so that's hard to complain about for what it was. Very nice in most respects, with one big BUT ... my room apparently used to be a smoking room and smelled terrible. Never did get used to it. Had a pretty decent looking breakfast bar that also served something up at dinner time. I had company functions so didn't try the dinner food, but I think it was lasagna one night and meatloaf the other. Couldn't sample much of the breakfast food either since I'm a vegetarian and they mixed ham into the quiche they were serving up. I'm sure most people would like it. Staff was friendly. Decent little exercise room. Location is fine if you have a car. Lot of choices in Phoenix, but I could see myself staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent spot but not first choice for a vacation - great for business and shopping”
Reviews.Author: Garland T
Reviews.Content: Its our own fault but we planned late and were running out of choices. I needed a split suite for my family of four and we landed at this Homewood Suites. The room was clean and I well kept by the housekeeping staff. Front desk staff was very helpful. My chief complaint was noise at night. We got a room in the far west side and there is a major intersection and cars and big truck are going through all night long. I would imagine the north side of this hotel might be bad also. If you get a room here request one on the south side. I don't think the east side is an option as that is where the office is located. This would be a great spot for two types of travelers - business and shoppers. There is a major shopping mall and business district nearby and this hotel would serve them well. The pool is small and we never did use it. The work out area is also small but this Homewood Suites has a great deal with the LA Fitness across the street. For $2/day/person you have access to a very up-to-date facility. The LA Fitness has a bunch of machines and free weight and even raquettball courts. Great shooing nearby. Since we were here several days, we took advantage of the local groceries store. Access to and from the hotel was super easy with highway 51 close. We found getting around Phoenix from this spit very easy. We were about 20 to 30 minutes from everything. End on a positive - on our last day they let us extend our checkout time to 2:00 pm. We had a late filght and that really helped.

Reviews.Title: “A bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Oonkwee L
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel stay I ever had. I was late checking in and was thus given a smoking room. Only after I said that I wanted to go to another hotel did she gave me a non smoking room next to the elevator shaft. When I entered the room I was met with a continuous hum and thought it was due to the elevator. Later at 2 am I figure that I cannot stand the noise anymore, which I figured out was due to a bad A/C, and I approached the front desk for another room. To my surprise I was given another non smoking which was as quiet as a graveyard. I was wondering why the first front desk girl first said that there are no more non smoking rooms and then gave me the room next to the elevator when there is a quiet non smoking room available. And I had put in a preference for a non smoking room when I made the reservation, and it was still on record

Reviews.Title: “Better than "just like home"”
Reviews.Author: becca970003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here February 9 - 15. My husband is a big coffee drinker, and we never made a pot of coffee in the room -- it was available 24 hours a day in the lobby. The staff was great, the breakfast was great, and the place was great. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Pengoonfan
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity to stay at this facility for 3 days February 6-9, 2012. I found the registration process very pleasant, helpful and cheerful. The room was about what I have come to expect from the Hilton chain which is clean, comfortable and in this case quiet. The suite was well laid out and very spacious which is comforting while traveling away from home. The evening reception was nice, however my only negative criticism if there is one is the breakfast time during the week begins at 6:30 am, which did not coordinate with my work schedule. All in all I would highly recommend the facility and will look to return on my next visit to the Phoenix area

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: jasag00
Reviews.Content: Clean and well located. The food is not good, and there is no one at the front desk ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great area, not so great pool”
Reviews.Author: rkucera
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 10 days for business in November. Luckily, the weather was chilly in Phoenix for that time of year, so I had no use for the pool. Had the weather been warm as usual in Phoenix, the pool would have been less than adequate. It was small and located in a shady courtyard. Other than that, I had a great experience and really enjoyed this property and its' location. The gym is also inadequate but they offer a $2 pass to the L.A Fitness accross the street. Hotel is very close to shopping and even walking distance to a couple bars and restaurants. Also very close to Camelback Mountain. The rooms are very nice, large and clean. They are set up like a small apartment with a totally separate bedroom and almost full sized kitchen. The free dinner and breakfast is a plus for long stays and is relatively good as free food goes. I would definately stay in a Homewood Suites again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: dml718
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel 2x in the past 2 months, babysitting our baby grandson. The first time we stayed (9 days), we were on the 2nd floor, in a very quiet room close to the elevator. It provided the peace & quiet we needed as well as being away from other guest rooms (I'm sure they didn't want to hear our grandson crying at 4:30 am!). The hotel provided a suitable crib for us both times. Each unit has a small kitchen with a decent size refrigerator, which we needed for the baby's milk and other supplies we purchased at the nearby Trader Joes and Frys Superstore. The kitchen has the basic amenities (microwave, coffee maker, 2 burner stove, dishes, and a few pots and pans. There is also a laundry room on the first floor, which we used a few times. The washer and dryer cost was quite reasonable. The maid service was good and we didn't lack for emptied wastebaskets or clean towels. The curtains in the bedroom and living room are sun blocking, so it keeps the room darker for an extra few winks in the morning, which we appreciated after getting up so early to feed the baby. We liked this place so much we came back the following month and stayed there over Thanksgiving. It was a different room, but very similar to the other one. Staff and service personnel were friendly and courteous. An extra bonus is a very decent complimentary breakfast served daily and an evening appetizer served Monday-Friday in the downstairs dining near the front desk. I should also mention they have 24 hours coffee, hot chocolate and tea downstairs in the lobby, as well as cool drinking water, While this place has a small indoor gym and outside swimming pool, we didn't have time to use them, but it is something to look forward to in the future. It felt like a "home away from home" and we would definitely return to this location when we travel back to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location much different from the airport”
Reviews.Author: TravelingChumley
Reviews.Content: Stayed five days asked for a high floor. The clerk said second floor and I said no. A fourth floor room facing the pool was assigned. The room was very spacious, small area to the right, living room and bedroom was suite like. The tub and toilet were separate from the sink. The light dinner was ok, but the beef was that mystery meat you had either at a school cafeteria or dining commons. And the school stuff was better!! Salads and chips available. Slept like a baby, did not hear a thing. Breakfast was ok, the ladies work very hard to keep the place running. One morning, someone must have called in sick cause a lady in a black frilly dress with heels and painted toenails worked the breakfast room. If she was at the sports bar across the street, I would have tired to talk her up to my room. Anyway, one glitch was my last day, I had cleared my room except for some cereal boxes and items in the fridge. I get back at 10am and the bed is made, everything cleared except for milk and juice in the fridge. I didn't mention that to the front desk, just thought it was unusual that the room was made with towels and bed done before I checked out. Good safe location easy access to and from locations, except for the mystery meat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a good value.”
Reviews.Author: bluefaery
Reviews.Content: I just checked into this hotel today and was pleasantly surprised. I lived down the street from this hotel awhile back and so I chose it for the area. It is a great safe location close to many great little wine bars, restaurants, and the Biltmore. It is also close to the freeway for easy access. The hotel staff was very friendly when I checked in and even called my room about 20 minutes later to make sure I was comfortable and had everything I needed. Breakfast and dinner are complimentary and the dinner tonight was pretty good. I booked this hotel about a month in advance and paid $95 (+ taxes)/night so I would consider it a good value. It's basically like a 1 bedroom apartment. I have a living room with a couch and a chair that both have ottomans. It has a small table with 2 chairs, a kitchen with a refrigerator, and dishwasher. There is plenty of closet space and a desk in the bedroom. This is a great place and deal for families or for people like me traveling several days for business. My only complaint is that there is a distinct mildewy odor when you first enter the room as if it needs to be aired out.

Reviews.Title: “great location & value!”
Reviews.Author: rainbowmoon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the Biltmore area of Phoenix, 10-15 minutes from the airport with easy access to highways. Across the street is Trader Joe's (for quick trips to stock the hotel fridge) and lots of restaurants close by. There's even an LA fitness gym in the same facility. Convenient to everything. We had a corner suite with a fireplace on the fourth floor. The bedroom had two double beds and plenty of space. The living room had a sofa bed that even my son said was more comfortable. Full kitchen with fridge, microwave, dishwasher and two burner stove. We were very comfortable and felt right at home. Complimentary breakfast each morning with eggs, waffles, fruit, yogurt, etc. helped start the day, not to mention easy on the wallet. We noticed a shuttle that took guests close by, but didn't use it as we had a rental car. The staff was friendly and helpful. My kids even played basketball at the half court behind the pool. All in all, we had a good time and the hotel offered everything we needed. Thank you for a nice stay and we plan to come back in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable suites with great food & staff”
Reviews.Author: Hojo35
Reviews.Content: My family made a stop here on our way to California. The suites were very spacious & comfortable & the food was excellent. The staff made us feel welcome :) we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Syn941
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great suite with a kitchen, living room and bedroom. I will definitely stay here again and again. I wanted a quiet room and I that is exactly what I got along with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HIManagement84
Reviews.Content: I am in the hotel business, no I am not with this hotel. This hotel offers excellant customer service, my room was very clean and the breakfast hostess was great. I just wanted to commend the General Manager, who did i not meet on this trip. Thank you for taking me while I was away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Freq_business_travlr
Reviews.Content: This is one of the older Homewood Suites where I’ve stayed, but it has been maintained well and very clean. Décor is reminiscent of a western theme with knotty pine furniture and kitchen flooring. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Conveniently located with shopping nearby including a Fry’s grocery (part of the Kroger family). I’m used to Kroger in Atlanta, and was pleasantly surprised that when I punched in my phone number it recognized my Kroger/Fry’s member card and saved me several dollars on my purchases. The in-suite full kitchen is a must for hotels these days IMHO, and I usually select Homewood Suites or Residence Inns for that reason. Nice light suppers provided at their “Welcome Home Reception” Monday through Thursday. Chicken fajitas with rice, refried beans and green salad were on the menu for Monday night. I was a bit surprised that beer and wine were not offered as at other locations I have been to in Las Vegas, Dallas, and Orlando, but I ended up eating there the rest of my Monday thru Friday stay for the convenience after working long days, even though I could have expensed meals elsewhere to my company. Menu items the rest of the week included meat loaf and mashed potatoes, marinara sauce and meatballs, and always included a salad bar. The evening suppers at Homewood are certainly several notches above the snack-type evening offerings at any Residence Inn where I’ve stayed. Wonderful daily breakfasts are also a plus, with rotating menu items including bacon, scrambled eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy, waffles, cold and hot cereal, fruits, yogurt, and a variety of beverages. I purposely chose a suite opposite the sports bar that another reviewer mentioned as being rather noisy using the online advance check-in system through the Hilton web site. I heard absolutely no noise from it, but I was only there Monday thru Friday, so they probably only really crank it up on weekends. Very friendly staff…every staff member said hello when passing them in the halls. Will definitely plan to stay here again the next time I’m in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: OMAHusker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with our 2 yr. old and we enjoyed it. It was conveniently located near 2 grocery stores, shopping, even a movie theater. The only downside we noticed was a little bit of noise from a sports bar with an outdoor patio across the street - but it did not keep us awake. The Biltmore area is very nice and easily explored on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for fussy guests”
Reviews.Author: 55cityhopper
Reviews.Content: We are Hilton Diamond club members meaning we stay at more Hilton chain hotels than your average travel guest. This is not a new hotel but it is well kept, clean, good service and very central location. A short drive from airport or to Scottsdale or any other areas. Nicer breakfast on weekends. Our room was a good size one bedroom apt. Usual comfy beds. Nice granite sink area in hallway leaves bathroom free if traveling with numbers. Sleep sofa in living area was used by adult daughter who said it was not great but not as bad as most sleep sofas in hotels. Pool is very small. Lobby is very large and has nice tables and lounging areas around fireplace. Full kitchen with all amenities except oven. Counter top burners, fridge, microwave and full dishwasher. Nice seating and footstools in living area. Perfect for extended stay or families.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel where I would be happy to stay again”
Reviews.Author: Kati74
Reviews.Content: Spent here three days for business, but had husband and daughter with me. We have stayed in Homewood Suites in other cities and have always been happy and were also with this one. Room was very nice, spacious, and had comfortable beds. The heated pool was ok, although it was quite small. I would have liked to have sun at the pool, but in November the sun was too low and I understand that other times of year it would be uncomfortably hot if the pool area was in the sun. The fitness room was very small, but had the basic things that we needed (cross-trainer, treadmill and weights). Breakfast was good and the suppers were ok for our needs. Service was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CarolEPBayarea_CA
Reviews.Content: I generally like Homewood Suites, and I liked this one. All the usual things - comfy bed, quiet rooms with that great kitchenette, and the breakfast and M-Th little dinners. I was disappointed that this one (unlike the one in Tempe, near the airport) doesn't have a gym, and the pool is small and there's no spa tub. But it is near shopping like Trader Joes and department stores, as well as some good restaurants, easy freeway access without having to listen to the sounds of the freeway; the staff were excellent without exception (amazing how much that actually contributes to one's stay). As with all hotels, I do wish the remotes for the TVs worked better...sometimes I had to practically get up and manually change the channel!!!! *gasp* lol...but aside from that, I can truly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Finally found a hotel in Phoenix where I will return”
Reviews.Author: caligirlburb
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the pretentious Hyatt downtown, the Doubletree near the airport, and the Marriott Residence Inn near the airport. From here on out, I'm staying at the Homewood Suites in the Biltmore area. It is quiet! My room was excellent -- configured beautifully. Had TONS of space. There is a grocery store within walking distance. The area is safe, and the staff was REALLY accommodating and helpful. The location is also just a few minutes from downtown and all the other major corporate areas for Phoenix. I actually prefer staying at a place that is more like home ... away from home. The bed was comfy. The place was VERY clean. I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Swou
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at this hotel, having arrived on July 29, 2010. It's just great. There is a full kitchen, the rooms and hotel are clean, it doesn't look dated, beds are comfortable, the entire staff is friendly and helpful, and their breakfast and dinner is good. We have a 6 month old and so the hotel provided a crib that can be wheeled from room to room which is quite convenient. There's a grocery store just across the street, and plenty of restaurants within a block. It's in a central location with access to SR 51 just down the block. We will definitely stay in this hotel again and recommend it to anyone visiting Phoenix. Oh and there's free wifi internet in all the rooms which is definitely a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: hotelgoer10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very big disappointment. The shower in our room did not work. We called to have it fixed and they said they would send someone right away, they didn't. Also, there were no plates or hardly any food when we went down to breakfast. This is just through one night and a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Find of the Century-Price/Value Leader!”
Reviews.Author: santabarbaraserenity
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Phoenix, we need a hotel to stay in at the last minute. We went onto trip advisor and started our search, finding this hotel. I had never stayed in a Homewood Suites and for whatever reason thought maybe they were a little too businessy and cold for a leisure trip. This is my new favorite for a variety of reasons: (1) Price!---an excellent suite/room with full kitchen including stove (no oven), refrigerator, microwave and dishwasher, comfortable furniture and bed and internet; (2) Price!--- included full breakfast and dinner! (3) Pool and sport court; (4) location by shopping and restaurants within walking distance and a short drive to the Esplanade and Biltmore shopping center. In the end, the biggest reason I will stay here again is the incredible value for what you get (under $85 before taxes) in a hotel conveniently located for my purposes. NOTE: Below I marked restaurant and room service because of breakfast and dinner service in the lobby and because they have a menu in the room that provides information on delivery to room from local restaurant (good enough as I am sure it arrives as quickly as if they had in-site room service).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, very happy with stay”
Reviews.Author: trvlr2009
Reviews.Content: Went to Phoenix to visit family and chose this hotel for the proximity to the family and user reviews. We were extremely satisified with our stay. Very clean and spacious rooms, friendly staff and decent breakfast. We did not take part in the evening meal but this is a great option to have. The pool and fitness center were nice and clean although not large but good to work out and cool down. Teenage daughter was thrilled with the internet connection when we had our down time. Great location, close to stores and easy to get around. No complaints, we will stay again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: spoons99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Homewood Suites because I was doing business at this particular hotel. The hotel is in great condition and has recently gone through a renovation of the guestrooms and some common areas. The hotel in general is very nice and is equiped with all necessary amenities and features including pool, business center and fitness center. High-Speed wireless internet is complimentary and is very fast. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable and the showers had good water pressure. The hotel serves a great complimentary warm breakfast that was actually filling and good. They also have a nightly buffett between 5 and 7 pm on Monday through Thursday, which is complimentary and looks like could satisfy dinner if the meal was good. All in all the hotel was excellent and I got a really good rate, which is well worth the value. Lastly, the hotel is approximately 5 blocks from Biltmore Mall, which has alot of nice restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: DoubleJoTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd hotel we stayed in during a two-week relocation. Other two didn't get good reviews from us. Meaning this good review should be taken seriously. 2 Adults, 2 Teenagers and 2 Dogs. We were there for 3 nights while we waited for our furniture to arrive in Phx (corporate relocation). What a great respite after a torturous 1000 mile drive to Phoenix. Our stay was top drawer for the relatively low price. Tastefully decorated, super clean suites, all the conveniences of home and attention only when you want it. Breakfast, welcome home dinners, pool with towels, biz center, suite shop and a first rate staff made these 3 days feel like a vacation instead of a corporate stop over. Add to that this hotel is central to everything in the Camelback/Biltmore area: plentiful shopping and restaurants in all prices ranges. By the time the movers arrived on the 4th day we were refreshed, rejuvenated and ready to unpack. I highly recommend this particular Homewood.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location...”
Reviews.Author: Wildfire_Diva
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location thru part of February and most of March. The location is great. Lots of restaurants, shopping and groceries within walking distance. The area felt safe and was relatively quiet. Only a few minutes from downtown and the airport, and easy access to most major thru ways (51, I-10, 101, 202, I-17). On my first stay they told me they only had one room left, a queen smoking. I asked to be moved at the first available opening, don't think they even tried. The coworker whom I was commuting with, who already had a room here had checked in a week earlier and they told him all they had was smoking then too. Those beds were not queen but double and the smell of smoke was almost intollerable. I had to keep my windows open constantly and even used a whole bottle of odor nutralizing spray. On my next stay (4 days between stays) I was given a king non-smoking, MUCH BETTER. [I do have to say that the suite with 2 dbls was more spacious than the king] I really enjoyed the evening receptions 4 days a week. However they would only put out a few things at a time and it would run out quickly and they were not being replaced quickly enough. The food area did not have good flow and would quickly get cluttered with people. The access to the Business center was difficult as people would "camp-out" on the computers for long periods of time. Wireless in the rooms was pretty hit and miss too. Overall I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: SpicynShellie
Reviews.Content: I had a corporate extended stay at this hotel and it was delightful. Nice sized suite with a very comfortable bed, plentiful pillows, and comfy duvet cover. 2 plasma screen TV's with one in the bedroom and one on the living area. Fully equipped kitchen with full size refrigerator, 2 burner stove top, microwave oven, dishwasher, and coffee pot. Dishes, flatware, and cookware included. Daily breakfast offering as well as an Evening Welcome Home light meal that was substantial enough for dinner. To save on your food budget, go to Trader Joe's and Fry's across the street in the shopping center. If you don't have a car with you, there is a complimentary shuttle that will take you within 5 miles of the hotel. Adam, one of the drivers was delightful and concerned that I called him to get a ride back to the hotel. Front Desk check in was not very informative but I quickly found my way on my own, thanks to Tripadvisor. As is my usual complaint, the coffee was dreadful and did not even give an ounce of a caffeine kick. I recommend bringing your own coffee or doubling up on the packets in the room and brewing your own. Housekeeping was super efficient and they run the dishwasher for you even if you just have a fork in it. Not very green thinking on their part but they cared to make sure the suite was just perfect every day. My room was quiet and comfortable and the neighborhood is excellent. Plenty of towels and Neutrogena amenities for the bath that are replenished every day. I truly felt like I was at home and would highly recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeneralManagerWHE
Reviews.Content: This was the second year we stayed at this hotel. Staff are always pleasant and helpful. I wasn't feeling well due to allergies and the Manager let me know that they had something there that I could purchase that would help. The rooms are nicely decorated and very clean. The hot breakfast and dinners Monday to Friday are very nice especially if you are wanting to shop more than eat. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for family”
Reviews.Author: 236hokie
Reviews.Content: We went to visit relatives for Thanksgiving. We had a 2 bedroom suite for our family of 2 adults, 3 kids (8,9,11). the room was clean, nicely furnished, quiet, comfortable. Kids were sold as soon as they saw a "plasma TV" right in their own room. Don't know if it's some low water deal or not, but the toilets clogged two times a day which is a pain with kids that don't notice such things. the pool was heated and we used that every day as well as the basketball court immediately adjacent. What ever they call their evening event, it's not a happy hour, so that was a little disappointing. But the kids loved the snacks. Breakfast was o.k. some egg dish and breakfast meat in buffet style along with toast, muffins, cereal, fruit, juices.

Reviews.Title: “Big bugs a problem”
Reviews.Author: JC2
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at the Homewood Suites Biltmore for six nights at the end of April. The breakfast buffet and use of the computer with free internet access was very nice. The staff was very helpful. The location was good for us, and close to shopping and many chain restaurants. The problem was the three big bugs we had in the room. One night there was a dead one on the floor near the beds; another day there was a live one running around on the ceiling; and another day there was an almost dead one on its back near the door. These were not small bugs either -- I would say they were 2 inches in length. The front desk person called them water bugs. Whatever they are, they are gross, and I would not stay there again without assurance that the bugs were gone.

Reviews.Title: “Quite acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel - by taxi - at 1:00 AM. The clerk was friendly, accommodating and informational. She was able to change our room at the last minute to give us a King (which was not available when we booked). The room itself was adequate, if nothing special. It was on the first floor, but not noisy, nor did it give the impression of being unsafe. Within walking distance are a Trader Joes, a Fry's supermarket, a Mervyn's and a host of other stores (so I can only surmise that when the other reviewer said that it is not pedestrian friendly that he or she would be unable to walk two blocks). The next morning, the hotel's shuttle took me to the rental car place a half mile or so down the street (Tip: when in Phoenix, never, NEVER rent a car at the airport, the fees are insane. Instead, book your rental at one of the Hertz or Enterprise locations in town, then return your car to the airport; you don't pay the airport taxes that way. Even better, if you can swing it, cab both ways to your hotel, and rent just while in town ... if you are there for any length of time, you will definitely save your cab fare, and will have less hassle than waiting for the stupid rental car shuttle at Sky Harbor). Back to the hotel: the breakfast was only fair, but edible. However, overall, we found the place pleasant and would return. Generally, our trips to Phoenix are not in the winter, and we found this place to have quite favorable rates for this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet room.”
Reviews.Author: blondeinsf
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at a Homewood Suites and I was happy. I found it nicer/cleaner than some of the Residence Inns I've stayed at. The bed was comfy, lots of soft pillows, a huge room service menue, and no problems with the internet service. I was upgrade to a 2 room suite based on being a Hilton VIP member, which was a nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Just adequate for a long stay”
Reviews.Author: redsoxgal-7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and two small children for a long stay- almost a month. The room was clean but smelled a little funny at first, almost like particleboard or something. It had been recently renovated so that might explain it but it did bother me almost the whole time. The staff were attentive and nice, the laundry facilities weren't the best (the dryers didn't work well), the gym had a couple of treadmills and a weight bench, and the breakfast was decent, although lacking in vegetarian choices. The pool was nice and clean, and the dining area for breakfast was also comfortable and clean. There is no park within walking distance for little children, which was disappointing. Also, the hotel is located on a main intersection that wasn't very pedestrian friendly. Even though there was shopping across the street it seemed safer to drive there! This hotel would be nice for a shorter stay, especially for those without little children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice size rooms. Great price thanks to Best Rates Guarantee. Room was clean. Breakfast was very good. Stayed on a Friday so can't speak about the manager's recepetion. Very good location. Bed was not the most comfortable. Also hotel does not stock conditioner just shampoo. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “i will come back to use homewood suites !!”
Reviews.Author: arnulfo
Reviews.Content: excellent location close to everything.. free shuttle within 5 miles/ spacious room/ friendly staff / clean/ fully stock kitchenette/ breakfast is good/ i will use them again....

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Phoenix - Biltmore
HotelInfo.Address: 2001 E. Highland Avenue, Phoenix, AZ 85016
